Key Match Events: The Padres equaled the National League Division Series at one game apiece with a 10-2 victory over the Dodgers.
The game was delayed for nearly 10 minutes in the seventh inning due to fans throwing objects onto the field.
The Padres hit six home runs during the game.
Jurickson Profar stole a home run from Mookie Betts in the first inning.
Fernando Tatis Jr. made a lunging catch of a Freeman drive in the fourth inning.
Jack Flaherty hit Tatis in the side in the sixth inning, leading to a confrontation.
Manny Machado led an emotional team meeting in the Padres' dugout after the security stoppage in the seventh inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts expressed disappointment over the fan behavior and the team's performance.
Padres manager Mike Shildt praised his team's resilience and ability to handle the hostile environment.
Fernando Tatis Jr. commented on the need for Dodgers fans to control their emotions.
Dave Roberts acknowledged the challenge of winning two out of three games against the Padres with the series moving to San Diego.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of the largest Dodger Stadium crowd of the season.
Freddie Freeman left the game in the sixth inning with a badly sprained ankle.
